result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Mcleod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence serving

superMiscConds.notes: 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Defendant to attend a Cognative programing intervention group like a criminal thinking course.
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and release of medical information.
Pay court cost with DNA surcharge, already has provided a DNA sample with prior prison sentence.
Not eligible for boot camp (Challenge program).
Eligible for earned release after served 5 yrs of incarceration

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations ad follow all recommendations of the assessment.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Restitution to be determined and is Joint/Several.
Restitution hearing can be requested and held via video for  Defendant.

Court calls case at 1:33 p.m. Defendant Brian J. Mcleod in court with attorney Edmund Jelinski and Atty Carroll. Defendant Brian J. Mcleod in custody. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties received and reviewed the PSI report.  ADA Cousin stated one correction.  No further corrections.  Victims were notified and none are present today.
Victim Impact Statement summary has been provided to the Court.
State makes sentencing recommendation: Prison sentence 15 yrs with 153 day precarcation  credit
1:58 p.m. Atty Jelinski calls Victoria McLeod, wife of Defendant, reads her written statement to the Court.  No Cross exam.
2:06 p.m.  Atty Jelinski makes sentencing recommendation. 13 yr prison. 153 day credit
2:27 p.m. Atty Carroll, co-defense counsel, concurs with Atty Jelinski recommendation and makes statement in support of the Defendant.
2:39 p.m. Defendant makes apologetic statements.
2:41 p.m. Court summaries the facts and reasons of findings.

BTC: *****************PRISON*******************
Ct 1: 943.02(1)(a)  Arson Building:  Prison, Determinate Sentence 14 yrs  at 9 yrs Incarceration & 5 yrs Extended Supervision, eligible for earned release after served 5 yrs of incarceration, consecutive to any other sentence serving.  

Ct 2: 943.10(1m)(a) Burglary:  Prison, Determinate Sentence 14 yrs at 9 yrs Incarceration & 5 yrs Extended Supervision,  concurrent with Count 1. Comply with same conditions as Count 1. 

Conditions of Count 1:
 Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Defendant to attend a Cognative programing intervention group like a criminal thinking course.
 AODA & comply with treatment recommendations ad follow all recommendations of the assessment.
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and release of medical information.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Pay court costs with DNA surcharge, already has provided a DNA sample with prior prison sentence.
Restitution is Joint/Several and to be determined and be paid at 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Restitution hearing can be requested via video for  Defendant.
Not eligible for boot camp (Challenge program).
Eligible for earned release after served 5 yrs of incarceration

Appeal rights provided
Referral form for Court Commissioner for Restitution Hearing filed

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian J. Mcleod in court with attorney Edmund Jelinski and D Nicholas Carroll. Defendant Brian J. Mcleod in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:07 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Both sides are requesting a PSI.

Atty Cousins states that Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2. Cts 3-4 will be dismissed and read in. 
State caps recommends at 15 yrs initial, 10 yrs extended supervision for count 1. Count 2 prison as well. Conditions of supervision and restitution will be discussed.

Atty Jelinski concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Jelinski and Attorney Carroll for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
All attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint prior to today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Arson
Count 2: Burglary
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In

Court will order a PSI.
Matter will be scheduled for a sentencing hearing after 60 days.
Court directs attys to schedule a sentencing date with Judicial Assistant this morning.

BY THE COURT:
Court revokes bond.

Voting notice is handed to Atty Jelinski for review.
Plea hearing on September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
State's
from TBE to Atty Jelinski
State's
State's Motions to Admit Defendant's Statements

Defendant Brian J. Mcleod in court with attorney Edmund Jelinski and D. Nicholas Carroll. Defendant Brian J. Mcleod in custody.  
Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Jelinski makes arguments to modify the bond at this time.  He has a maintenance job at Elizabeth Inn waiting for him.  Asks to modify $50,000 to a significantly lower cash bond.  Was to have his wisdom teeth removed a week after his arrest.  Causing him discomfort.  Is experiencing anxiety and depression and has a meeting with the Social Worker.  Wonder if he could have a psychological evaluation.  Not talking about an NGI plea or competency.  
Atty Cousins makes arguments in opposition to the modification of bond.  Charges are substantial.  Facing 79 1/2 years of incarceration on all counts.  Inherent risk of flight.  There was talk of fleeing to Texas to avoid.  Previous escape charges.  Originally State recommended a $100,000 cash bond. 
Atty Jelinski makes additional arguments to the Court.  Escape charges were before he had a family.  Believes it was Nowak who indicated going to Texas.  He never had any intention of fleeing. 
Court questions damage amount listed in the complaint. 
Atty Cousins responds.  That amount was damages to items still remaining in the house. 
Atty Jelinski responds.  House was uninhabited at this time.  
Court questions Atty Jelinski.  
Atty Jelinski indicates house was not insured.  Discovery gives no indication of what the value of the building was. 

BY THE COURT: 
Monetary condition of bond is to assure defendant's appearances.  Initially set by Judge Finn.  Court has reviewed the complaint and heard arguments of the parties today.  Court notes defendant faces signification prison time.   Case against the defendant, atleast on paper, seems to be fairly strong.  Defendant admitted to being at the home that was burned.  Another witness has placed the defendant in the area.  State has indicated they will be pursuing a prison sentence.  Defendant has a past criminal history and significant history that has sent him to prison in the past.  Was on probation when this case took place.  Certainly gives the defendant incentive to flee.  Court believes the defendnant is a significant risk of flight and Court will deny the motion to modify the bond.  With regard to the wisdom teeth, that is an issue for the defendant to deal with in the jail and the Court will not order a psychological evaluation at this point but may wish to discuss with the Social Worker at the jail.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Atty Jelinski makes arguments in support of motion to modify bond.  Request a $500 cash bond or a signature bond. 
Atty Cousins requests that this motion be brought in Branch 1, where the case is assigned. 

Court requires the motion to be scheduled in Branch 1 for Judge Eagon to address.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
NOT GUILTY Pleas entered.
